page.title: 01Tavistock - A Market Town
page.content: Tavistock is a town on the edge of Dartmoor. It lies 15 miles to the north of the city of Plymouth and is near the border of Devon and Cornwall. It has a population of about 10,000. {* * * * * * * * * * * *} The main occupations are farming and shop employment but many are employed in surrounding areas, especially in Plymouth. {* * * * * * * * * * * *} The River Tavy flows through Tavistock and it is from this river that the town gets its name. Tavistock receives many tourists each summer. {* * * * * * * * * * * *} There is a selection of primary schools, one main secondary school, a prep school and Kelly College which is a Public School. Tavistock is a typical Devon market town.
